    version: 0.9

    Border Utilities

    Apply consistent borders, radii, and styles using theme-aware utilities that support token-based customization and responsive design.

    Border utility classes let you quickly apply and customize border width, color, radius, and styles. All classes are based on your design system tokens and integrate seamlessly with dark/light themes. Use them to style cards, buttons, containers, or layout boundaries.

    Available Tokens

    
						--border-width
						--border-style
						--color-border

    Usage

    • Preview
    • Markup

    This element uses .border to apply the default tokenized border.

    .border.border-primary combines default border with primary color.

    .border-0 removes all borders even if defined by parent.

    
									<div class="border padding">
										<p>This element uses <code>.border</code> to apply the default tokenized border.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border border-primary padding">
										<p><code>.border.border-primary</code> combines default border with primary color.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border-0 padding">
										<p><code>.border-0</code> removes all borders even if defined by parent.</p>
									</div>

    Border Widths

    • Preview
    • Markup

    .border.border-thin applies a 1px width border.

    .border.border-thick applies a 2px width border.

    
									<div class="border border-thin padding">
										<p><code>.border.border-thin</code> applies a 1px width border.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border border-thick padding">
										<p><code>.border.border-thick</code> applies a 2px width border.</p>
									</div>

    Border Sides

    • Preview
    • Markup

    .border-top applies border only to the top side.

    .border-left applies border only to the left side.

    .border-right applies border only to the right side.

    .border-bottom applies border only to the bottom side.

    
									<div class="border-top padding">
										<p><code>.border-top</code> applies border only to the top side.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border-left padding">
										<p><code>.border-left</code> applies border only to the left side.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border-right padding">
										<p><code>.border-right</code> applies border only to the right side.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border-bottom padding">
										<p><code>.border-bottom</code> applies border only to the bottom side.</p>
									</div>

    Border Axes

    • Preview
    • Markup

    .border-x applies borders to left and right sides.

    .border-y applies borders to top and bottom sides.

    
									<div class="border-x padding">
										<p><code>.border-x</code> applies borders to left and right sides.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border-y padding">
										<p><code>.border-y</code> applies borders to top and bottom sides.</p>
									</div>

    Border Styles

    • Preview
    • Markup

    .border-dashed sets dashed style.

    .border-dotted sets dotted style.

    .border-double sets double border style.

    
									<div class="border border-dashed padding">
										<p><code>.border-dashed</code> sets dashed style.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border border-dotted padding">
										<p><code>.border-dotted</code> sets dotted style.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border border-double padding">
										<p><code>.border-double</code> sets double border style.</p>
									</div>

    Border Colors

    • Preview
    • Markup

    .border-primary uses primary token color.

    .border-success shows a success color border.

    .border-warning applies a warning-themed border.

    .border-danger for error or danger alerts.

    .border-muted for neutral/light-gray borders.

    .border-muted for neutral/light-gray borders.

    .border-white useful for dark backgrounds.

    .border-transparent hides the border visually while keeping spacing.

    
									 <div class="border border-primary padding">
										<p><code>.border-primary</code> uses primary token color.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border border-success padding">
										<p><code>.border-success</code> shows a success color border.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border border-warning padding">
										<p><code>.border-warning</code> applies a warning-themed border.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border border-danger padding">
										<p><code>.border-danger</code> for error or danger alerts.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border border-muted padding">
										<p><code>.border-muted</code> for neutral/light-gray borders.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border border-strong padding">
										<p><code>.border-muted</code> for neutral/light-gray borders.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border border-white padding">
										<p><code>.border-white</code> useful for dark backgrounds.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border border-transparent padding">
										<p><code>.border-transparent</code> hides the border visually while keeping spacing.</p>
									</div>

    Border Radius

    Basic Radius

    • Preview
    • Markup

    .rounded-xs applies small radius.

    .rounded-sm applies small radius.

    .rounded applies small radius.

    .rounded-md applies small radius.

    .rounded-lg applies small radius.

    .rounded-xl applies small radius.

    
									<div class="border rounded-xs padding">
										<p><code>.rounded-xs</code> applies small radius.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border rounded-sm padding">
										<p><code>.rounded-sm</code> applies small radius.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border rounded padding">
										<p><code>.rounded</code> applies small radius.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border rounded-md padding">
										<p><code>.rounded-md</code> applies small radius.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border rounded-lg padding">
										<p><code>.rounded-lg</code> applies small radius.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border rounded-sm padding">
										<p><code>.rounded-xl</code> applies small radius.</p>
									</div>

    Pill & Circle

    • Preview
    • Markup

    .rounded-pill

    .rounded-circle

    .rounded-square

    
									<div class="border rounded-pill padding" style="width: 200px;">
										<p><code>.rounded-pill</code></p>
									</div>

									<div class="border rounded-circle" style="width: 100px; height: 100px; border-radius: 50%; display: flex; align-items: center; justify-content: center; margin-top: 1rem;">
										<p style="text-align: center;"><code>.rounded-circle</code></p>
									</div>

									<div class="border rounded-square" style="width: 100px; height: 100px; border-radius: 50%; display: flex; align-items: center; justify-content: center; margin-top: 1rem;">
										<p style="text-align: center;"><code>.rounded-square</code></p>
									</div>

    Sides Only

    • Preview
    • Markup

    .rounded-top applies radius to top only.

    .rounded-bottom applies radius to bottom only.

    .rounded-left applies radius to left only.

    .rounded-right applies radius to right only.

    
									<div class="border rounded-top padding">
										<p><code>.rounded-top</code> applies radius to top only.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border rounded-bottom padding">
										<p><code>.rounded-bottom</code> applies radius to bottom only.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border rounded-left padding">
										<p><code>.rounded-left</code> applies radius to left only.</p>
									</div>

									<div class="border rounded-right padding">
										<p><code>.rounded-right</code> applies radius to right only.</p>
									</div>
